productionline

Class UserAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • productionline.UserAction

  • public class UserAction
extends java.lang.Object
    Allow a user to Add a new product and to specify how many items of that product should be created. The program will then create these items and store them in a collection. The collection can be displayed at any time. New Products can be added at any time. Production statistics can be displayed â€“ Total items produced, number of each item, the number of unique products created etc. The operator will decide when to stop the program.

    • Method Detail

      • getStartUp

        public static void getStartUp()
        The start point for the program.

      • switchForAddProduct

        public static void switchForAddProduct()
        The switch statement used for the add product option in the Main menu.

      • addAudio

        public static void addAudio()
        When this method is called it will get user input. The user will enter how many devices they would like to add to the collection. The user will enter the name of the product. The user will enter the product details. An AudioPlayer object will be created and added to the productList.

      • addMovie

        public static void addMovie()
        Mehtod used to add a MoviePlayer object to the productList, This method will ask the user how many MoviePlayers there are. The user will enter the product name. The user will enter the choice of LCD or LED ad the monitor type. The user will enter the choice for Screen resolution, refresh rate, and response time. A MoviePlayer Object will be created from the user input and added to the productList.

      • getStats

        public static void getStats()
        This method will get the total number of products in the productList. This method will get the total number of MoviePlayer objects in the productList. This method will get the total number of AudiPlayer objects in the productList. This method will get the total number of unique objects in the productList.
